item.title: WindowMaker in the XXI Century
item.description: I’m running WindowMaker as my desktop environment. Usually. That is, I keep returning to it. For the last few years, using Linux meant using Gnome 3. It’s not bad as such, except that it uses far too many resources for things I think don’t have to use that many resources. Also, it keeps losing functionality I like. One such is moving windows by dragging anywhere on them while Alt is pressed.
